course_title: Multidiscipline Design Studio: Introduction to Grapic Design
class_notes:
Multidiscipline Design Studio: Introduction to Graphic Design
In this course, students will create digital designs and drawings, both for graphic design and visual art purposes. Students will gain fluency in using the Adobe Creative Suite software, specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign. Research and conceptual interests of design will also be explored, splitting the focus of the semester equally onto both the content and the creation of digital art. 
Course notes: 
A student subscription to Adobe CC will be necessary for this course and can be purchased for $19.99/mo through the Adobe website. If the subscription cost is a barrier for you but you want to take this class, do not be deterred because there are other options for accessing the software for free including remote use of the Emory's MediaLab. Specifics of how and what to enroll in will be provided by the instructor at the beginning of the semester.
course_description: This course is a multi-disciplinary course that will teach students how to write an art proposal, how to gather field research, and how to talk with experts about important topics. This research will be woven into the process of creating visual models, designs, and drawings.
schedule_location: TTh 1pm-2:15pm in Math & Science Center - E301A
sections: Class Nbr: 1952, Section #: 1, Type: ART, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: J. Foley, Status: Open
